conclusion: The problem involves finding the internal resistance of a power supply using a resistance box and an ideal voltmeter.
The circuit diagram shows a power supply with internal resistance r, a resistance box R, an ideal voltmeter V, and a switch S.
When the resistance box reads R1 = 2Ω, the voltmeter reads U1 = 3V; when the resistance box reads R2 = 6Ω, the voltmeter reads U2 = 4.5V.
The internal resistance of the power-supply is r = 3 Ω.
